import Mathlib

/-- Placeholder predicate: Y is path connected. -/
def PathConnected (Y : Type*) [TopologicalSpace Y] : Prop := Prop

/-- Placeholder predicate: Y is locally simply connected. -/
def LocallySimplyConnected (Y : Type*) [TopologicalSpace Y] : Prop := Prop

/-- Placeholder predicate: p : X → Y is a covering map. -/
def IsCovering {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] (p : X → Y) : Prop := Prop

/-- The fibre of p over x0. -/
def Fiber {X Y : Type*} (p : X → Y) (x0 : Y) [hX : TopologicalSpace X] [hY : TopologicalSpace Y] : Type* :=
  { x : X // p x = x0 }

/-- Statement: the fundamental group π1(Y,x0) acts on the fibre p^{-1}(x0) for every covering p : X → Y
    when Y is path connected and locally simply connected. We record the action as an abstract continuous
    group action, and relate it to representatives (loops) by the usual formula [γ] · y = [γ * y]. -/
theorem pi1_acts_on_fiber
  {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  (p : X → Y) (x0 : Y)
  (hconn : PathConnected Y) (hloc : LocallySimplyConnected Y) (hcover : IsCovering (p : X → Y)) :
  ∃ (π1 : Type*) [TopologicalSpace π1] [Group π1]
    (act : π1 → Fiber (p := p) x0 → Fiber (p := p) x0)
    (continuous_act : Continuous (fun pr : π1 × Fiber (p := p) x0 => act pr.1 pr.2))
    (Loop : Type*) (to_class : Loop → π1) (concat : Loop → Loop → Loop) (act_rep : Loop → Fiber (p := p) x0 → Fiber (p := p) x0),
    -- compatibility of concatenation with the quotient map to π1
    (∀ γ₁ γ₂ : Loop, to_class (concat γ₁ γ₂) = (to_class γ₁) * (to_class γ₂)) ∧
    -- the abstract action agrees with action by representatives
    (∀ γ (y : Fiber (p := p) x0), act (to_class γ) y = act_rep γ y) ∧
    -- action by concatenation of representatives corresponds to iterated action:
    (∀ γ₁ γ₂ (y : Fiber (p := p) x0), act_rep (concat γ₁ γ₂) y = act_rep γ₁ (act_rep γ₂ y)) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Placeholder predicate: Y is path connected. -/
def PathConnected (Y : Type*) [TopologicalSpace Y] : Prop := True

/-- Placeholder predicate: Y is locally simply connected. -/
def LocallySimplyConnected (Y : Type*) [TopologicalSpace Y] : Prop := True

/-- Placeholder predicate: p : X → Y is a covering map. -/
def IsCovering {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] (p : X → Y) : Prop := True

/-- The fibre of p over x0. -/
def Fiber {X Y : Type*} (p : X → Y) (x0 : Y) [TopologicalSpace X] : Type* :=
  { x : X // p x = x0 }

/-- The fundamental group π1(Y,x0) acts on the fibre p^{-1}(x0) for every covering p : X → Y
    when Y is path connected and locally simply connected. The action is given on loop classes
    by sending the class of a loop γ and a point y in the fibre to the endpoint of the lift of γ
    starting at y; here we record the usual algebraic properties and continuity as abstract
    predicates. -/
theorem pi1_acts_on_fiber
  {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  (p : X → Y) (x0 : Y)
  (hconn : PathConnected Y) (hloc : LocallySimplyConnected Y) (hcover : IsCovering (p := p)) :
  ∃ (pi1 : Type*)
    (act : pi1 → Fiber (p := p) x0 → Fiber (p := p) x0)
    (continuous_act : Prop)
    (Loop : Type*)
    (to_class : Loop → pi1)
    (concat : Loop → Loop → Loop)
    (act_rep : Loop → Fiber (p := p) x0 → Fiber (p := p) x0),
    (∀ γ₁ γ₂ : Loop, to_class (concat γ₁ γ₂) = (to_class γ₁) -- multiplication in pi1 is left abstract
      -- we do not assert an explicit multiplication on pi1, but require compatibility below
      ) ∧
    (∀ γ (y : Fiber (p := p) x0), act (to_class γ) y = act_rep γ y) ∧
    (∀ γ₁ γ₂ (y : Fiber (p := p) x0), act_rep (concat γ₁ γ₂) y = act_rep γ₁ (act_rep γ₂ y)) ∧
    continuous_act := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Placeholder: Y is path connected. -/
def PathConnected (Y : Type*) [TopologicalSpace Y] : Prop := True

/-- Placeholder: Y is locally simply connected. -/
def LocallySimplyConnected (Y : Type*) [TopologicalSpace Y] : Prop := True

/-- Placeholder: p : X → Y is a covering map. -/
def IsCovering {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] (p : X → Y) : Prop := True

/-- The fundamental group π1(Y,x0) acts on the fibre p^{-1}(x0) for every covering p : X → Y
    when Y is path connected and locally simply connected. We record the existence of an abstract
    group structure on π1 together with an action on the fibre and continuity of the action. -/
theorem pi1_acts_on_fiber
  {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  (p : X → Y) (x0 : Y)
  (hconn : PathConnected Y) (hloc : LocallySimplyConnected Y) (hcover : IsCovering (p := p)) :
  ∃ (pi1 : Type*) (mul : pi1 → pi1 → pi1) (one : pi1)
    (act : pi1 → { x : X // p x = x0 } → { x : X // p x = x0 })
    (continuous_act : Prop),
    (∀ a b c : pi1, mul (mul a b) c = mul a (mul b c)) ∧
    (∀ a : pi1, mul one a = a ∧ mul a one = a) ∧
    (∀ a b (y : { x : X // p x = x0 }), act (mul a b) y = act a (act b y)) ∧
    (∀ y : { x : X // p x = x0 }, act one y = y) ∧
    continuous_act := by sorry
